definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: And I'm planning one in Sacramento in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 春天时，我在萨克拉门托会有一个活动。

sentences.english: And you had Shiloh Baptist when you were in Sacramento.
sentences.chinese: 你在萨克拉门托的时候还有Shiloh浸信会。

sentences.english: Sacramento State can call him their most famous dropout.
sentences.chinese: 萨克拉门托州立小学称他是该校最著实的停门生。

sentences.english: The Central Pacific, taking Sacramento for its starting-point, extends eastwards to meet the road from Omaha.
sentences.chinese: 这一段叫中央太平洋铁路，火车以萨克拉门托为起点。

sentences.english: The tour kicks off on June 16th in Sacramento.
sentences.chinese: 美巡赛揭幕六月16日在萨克拉门托。

definition: St Louis, large city in eastern Missouri
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania/abbr. for 費拉德爾菲亞|费拉德尔菲亚[Fei4 la1 de2 er3 fei1 ya4]
